sect2.title: Installation of Linux-Libc-Headers
sect2.para: For years it has been common practice to use raw kernel headers (straight from a kernel tarball) in /usr/include, but over the last few years, the kernel developers have taken a strong stance that this should not be done. This gave birth to the linux-libc-headers project, which was designed to maintain an Application Programming Interface (API) stable version of the Linux headers.
If your architecture is not i386 (compatible), adjust the first command accordingly.
